docs.snippet: A class-action suit by Silicon Valley engineers against companies including Google, Apple and Intel has revealed details of an agreement among them not to cold-call one another’s employees....
docs.lead_paragraph: A class-action suit by Silicon Valley engineers against companies including Google, Apple and Intel has revealed details of an agreement among them not to cold-call one another’s employees.

headline.main: Engineers Allege Hiring Collusion in Silicon Valley
headline.print_headline: Engineers Allege Hiring Collusion in Silicon Valley

docs.abstract: Class-action lawsuit by Silicon Valley engineers alleges that several companies, including Google, Apple and Intel, agreed between 2005 and 2009 not to poach one another's employees; case involves 64,000 programmers seeking billions of dollars in damages; alleges collusion was spearheaded by Apple founder Steve Jobs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The workplaces of Facebook, Twitter and Google may look whimsical. But each design is calculated to mirror its company’s values and culture.

headline.main: The Monuments of Tech

docs.abstract: Silicon Valley companies are increasingly paying builders to fuse their values of speed, change and productivity with their perceived corporate smarts and quirkiness; workplaces of Facebook, Twitter and Google may look whimsical, but each distinctive design is calculated to mirror its company’s values and culture.

docs.snippet: A class action lawsuit against employers in Silicon Valley, including Apple and Google, has lifted the curtain on secret, anti-competitive deals....
docs.lead_paragraph: A class action lawsuit against employers in Silicon Valley, including Apple and Google, has lifted the curtain on secret, anti-competitive deals.

headline.main: Colluding Against Programmers

docs.abstract: Editorial cites class action lawsuit brought on behalf of software programmers and other technical professionals against seven large employers in Silicon Valley, including Apple and Google; observes suit has lifted curtain on secret, anti-competitive deals; says case undermines egalitarian and competitive image of technology industry.

headline.main: The Future of Internet Freedom

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Google executives Eric E Schmidt and Jared Cohen outlines challenges of confronting Internet censorship across the globe; contends that technology to defeat censorship exists, but making it available to everyone requires more money and attention from private companies and governments.

docs.snippet: Google recently removed Agloe, N.Y., in the western Catskills, from its map, but how it endured on area charts for so long remains a cartographic mystery....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google recently removed Agloe, N.Y., in the western Catskills, from its map, but how it endured on area charts for so long remains a cartographic mystery.

headline.main: Seeking a Town on the Border of Fiction and Reality
headline.print_headline: Seeking a Town on the Border Between Fiction and Reality

docs.abstract: Agloe, fictitious town in the western Catskills of New York State that was recently removed from Google Maps, was invented by mapmakers in 1920s to guard against copyright infringement; for some reason, the name stuck, but how it endured on area charts for so long remains a cartographic mystery.

docs.snippet: A dashboard donnybrook has erupted among tech companies vying to clean up the clutter of controls in the next generation of connected cars....
docs.lead_paragraph: A dashboard donnybrook has erupted among tech companies vying to clean up the clutter of controls in the next generation of connected cars.

headline.main: Battle of the Dash: Tech Companies Try to Get Their Apps in a Row
headline.print_headline: Battle of the Dash: Tech Companies Try to Get Their Apps in a Row

docs.abstract: Apple, Microsoft, Google and QNX are involved in fierce competition to become dominant provider of dashboard information in next generation of connected automobiles; tangle of contracts and multiple layers of software make it unlikely that a single company will come out on top any time soon.

docs.snippet: A court battle between Apple and Samsung over patents could have a bigger effect on Google’s Android operating system....

headline.main: Daily Report: Apple-Samsung Patent Face-Off Has Google in Crossfire

docs.abstract: A court battle between Apple and Samsung over patents could have a bigger effect on Google’s Android operating system.

docs.snippet: Apple is seeking about $2 billion in damages from Samsung, which in turn says Apple violated its patents, but the case could also have major implications for Google....
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple is seeking about $2 billion in damages from Samsung, which in turn says Apple violated its patents, but the case could also have major implications for Google.

headline.main: Apple’s War on Samsung Has Google in Crossfire
headline.print_headline: Apple’s War on Samsung Has Google in Crossfire

docs.abstract: Battle between Apple and Samsung has Google caught in crossfire, since some features in Samsung devices that Apple objects to are part of Google's Android system; Apple is seeking in lawsuit about $2 billion from Samsung for selling phones and tablets that Apple says violate five of its mobile software patents; Samsung, meanwhile, says Apple violated two of its patents.
